title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

items.title: Building Prior Authorization Systems for Healthcare Payors with Amazon Bedrock

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this session demonstrates using Amazon Bedrock foundation models to build an intelligent prior authorization system for healthcare payors that aligns with CMS regulatory requirements. AWS Engineers outline an architecture combining advanced natural language processing with healthcare-specific workflows to automate Local Coverage Determinations, analyze complex medical documentation, and produce explainable prior authorization recommendations to meet CMS-0057-F timelines while maintaining compliance and accuracy.
bullets: Leverages Amazon Bedrock foundation models and advanced NLP for healthcare workflows
Automates processing of Local Coverage Determinations (LCDs)
Analyzes complex medical documentation to inform decisions
Generates explainable prior authorization recommendations for auditability
Aims to meet CMS-0057-F timelines while improving operational efficiency and compliance
takeaways: Helps payors meet CMS-0057-F regulatory timelines—reduces compliance risk for authorization processes
Automation of LCDs and medical-document analysis can significantly improve throughput and operational efficiency
Explainable recommendations support auditability and regulatory transparency for prior authorization decisions
Built on Amazon Bedrock and AWS architectural patterns—plan for integration with managed generative-AI services and existing payer workflows
Session includes real-world examples—consider piloting the approach to validate fit and impact before full deployment

items.title: Transforming Healthcare Document Processing Workflows with Generative AI

ai.summary: Based on the available description… This session demonstrates AWS's GenAI Intelligent Document Processing (GenAIIDP) solution, which combines Amazon Textract and Bedrock to automate classification, data extraction, and criteria validation for complex medical documents. The talk highlights live demonstrations and architecture deep-dives showing how the solution cuts days-long manual processes to minutes while maintaining HIPAA compliance and covering integration and ROI best practices.
bullets: Combines Amazon Textract and Bedrock for automated classification, extraction, and criteria validation.
Transforms manual medical document workflows from days to minutes.
Maintains HIPAA compliance for healthcare document processing.
Includes live demos and architecture deep-dives for scalable pipeline implementation.
Covers integration patterns with existing systems and ROI optimization best practices.
takeaways: Dramatic processing-time reductions imply higher throughput and potential cost/efficiency gains for document workloads.
Use of managed services (Textract, Bedrock) warrants evaluation of cloud integration and operational models.
HIPAA compliance emphasis means infrastructure and deployment choices must support healthcare regulatory requirements.
Architecture deep-dives and integration patterns provide practical guidance for building scalable, production-ready pipelines.
ROI best practices help prioritize where to replace manual steps with automated document processing first.

items.title: TTEC accelerates AI deployment and revenue streams with Google Cloud Consulting

ai.summary: Based on the available description… TTEC partnered with Google Cloud Consulting to rapidly prototype and deploy generative AI solutions, unlocking new revenue streams while streamlining operations and boosting developer productivity. Google Cloud Consulting accelerated TTEC's digital transformation timeline and expanded what the company sees as possible for its business.
bullets: TTEC worked with Google Cloud Consulting to quickly prototype and deploy GenAI solutions.
The effort unlocked entirely new revenue streams for TTEC.
GenAI combined with Google Cloud infrastructure helped streamline operations.
Developer productivity was boosted through the deployed solutions and tooling.
Consulting support compressed the digital transformation timeline and expanded business ambitions.
takeaways: Ensure scalable cloud infrastructure to support rapid GenAI prototyping that can turn into revenue-generating products.
Engage cloud consulting partners to shorten transformation timelines and reduce internal ramp-up time.
Invest in developer tooling and cloud services to materially improve developer productivity and operational efficiency.
Treat GenAI initiatives as potential business-expansion levers, not just pilot projects, when infrastructure and consulting support are in place.

items.title: Year-end toolkit: Strengthening audit committee collaboration

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this episode focuses on how finance teams can strengthen collaboration with audit committees during the year-end accounting and reporting process. It highlights streamlining reporting and addressing emerging oversight areas such as AI, enterprise risk management, transformation initiatives, cyber risk, and proxy disclosures.
bullets: Strengthening management/audit committee communication and collaboration (1:18)
Key year-end accounting and reporting issues for finance teams (10:10)
Oversight of AI: risks, opportunities, and controls (15:02)
Enhancing enterprise risk oversight and navigating evolving cyber risk in the age of AI (21:33 & 27:35)
Elevating proxy disclosures (36:05)
takeaways: Engage audit committees early on AI initiatives and related control frameworks so governance understands risks and opportunities relevant to data center and grid operations.
Prepare concise, decision-useful year-end reporting that highlights major transformation initiatives and their financial/reporting impacts.
Make enterprise risk and cyber briefings routine and tailored to operational resilience, emphasizing AI-driven threat vectors and mitigation plans.
Ensure proxy disclosures and governance communications reflect oversight of technology, risk management, and significant transformation projects.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the video shows Jo discovering the power of Copilot Groups and highlights that route planning is made easy. It’s presented as a brief demonstration of Copilot’s route-planning capabilities.
bullets: Description emphasizes route planning made easy.
Jo is shown discovering the power of Copilot Groups.
Focus is on Copilot Groups as a feature for planning.
Uses hashtags: #copilot #microsoftcopilot #ai.
takeaways: Highlights Copilot Groups’ route-planning capability, which is relevant for coordinating field teams and site visits.
Points to a tool that could simplify logistics and multi-stop routing common in grid and data-center operations.
Signals value in evaluating Copilot Groups for operational planning workflows that depend on efficient routing.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… KPMG podcast guests Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska discuss how AI is already integrated into audit work, enabling analysis of full populations, automating repetitive tasks, and supporting better decision-making. They outline specific tools (AI Transaction Scoring, Clara AI, KPMG Clara) and cover impacts on auditor skills, client communication, data security, regulation, and potential AI-related risks.
bullets: AI Transaction Scoring enables analysis of full populations rather than sampling.
Clara AI provides conversational assistance and specialized agents to support auditors.
KPMG Clara platform manages audits in real time; Clara for Clients modernizes client communication.
AI aids documentation and disclosure analysis while shifting auditor roles and required competencies.
Discussion highlights implementation challenges: adoption, data security, regulatory environment, and potential risks.
takeaways: Prepare systems and data for full-population analytics — auditors will expect accessible, high-quality datasets.
Integrate real-time reporting capabilities to align with platforms like KPMG Clara and support faster audits.
Plan for workforce upskilling in AI and data-analysis skills to interact effectively with AI-driven audit tools.
Prioritize data security and regulatory compliance when sharing operational or audit-related data with external tools.
Assess and mitigate AI-specific risks (accuracy, governance, controls) before automating audit-relevant processes.
